Writing Book Nook Contact About

I recently graduated from the University of Vienna with a master's in Austrian Studies. For my thesis, I wrote about the terms and concepts of Mikhail M. Bakhtin. Some of my interests include the German language, Slavic Languages (Czech & Russian), poetry, movies, and the translation of literary and philosophical texts.

Prior to studying at the University of Vienna, I worked as an English Teaching Assistant in Austria, which was made possible by the Austrian-American Educational Council. In 2014, I graduated from Knox College (in Galesburg, IL) with a B.A. in Philosophy and a minor in German.

Two days after finishing my master's, the quarantine began. I have used that time to learn to code and build websites, read Russian literature, and write. I also bought a kettlebell and have been swinging that around for the past few months.

J. G. Sheppard - 2020
